meanings.definition: To break free from confinement or control.
meanings.sent1: The prisoner tried to escape through the window.
meanings.sent2: The cat managed to escape from the room.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel found a way to escape the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was an escape from the seriousness of the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The butterfly's colorful wings made its escape from the net even more beautiful.

meanings.definition: A means of breaking free from confinement or control.
meanings.sent1: The key was his escape from the locked room.
meanings.sent2: The tunnel served as their escape from the prison.
meanings.sent3: The secret passage was a clever escape from the castle.
meanings.sent4: Music became her escape from the stress of daily life.
meanings.sent5: The hot air balloon provided a thrilling escape from the ground.

meanings.definition: To avoid or evade something unpleasant.
meanings.sent1: She tried to escape the rain by running under a tree.
meanings.sent2: The mouse managed to escape the cat's claws.
meanings.sent3: The student tried to escape doing his homework by pretending to be sick.
meanings.sent4: His mind would often escape to happier memories during tough times.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh flowers helped her escape the smell of the garbage truck.

meanings.definition: A way of avoiding or evading something unpleasant.
meanings.sent1: Reading was her escape from the stress of work.
meanings.sent2: Taking long walks in nature was his escape from city life.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show provided a much-needed escape from reality.
meanings.sent4: The painting served as an escape from the monotony of everyday routines.
meanings.sent5: The beach was a perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of the city.
